com.nxp.id.jcopx
Class JCOPXException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          java.lang.RuntimeException
              javacard.framework.CardRuntimeException
                  com.nxp.id.jcopx.JCOPXException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class JCOPXException
extends javacard.framework.CardRuntimeException

Generic exception class that is used by features out of NXPs JCOPX package to indicate invalid usage. If this exception gets caught, the provided reason code will give an indication about the error occurred.
Excpetion Code Usage:
o) DESFire Emulation: 0x0100 - 0x01FF
o) Secure Messaging: 0x0200 - 0x02FF
o) Multi MIFARE Emulation: 0x0300 - 0x03FF

See Also:
Serialized Form

SM_BAD_PADDING

public static final short SM_BAD_PADDING
Wrong padding in decryption of the APDU command data This might be:
  • Wrong padding indicator (0x01) in DO87
  • Padding does not end with 0x80 0x00*

See Also:

SM_DO_UNEXPECTED

public static final short SM_DO_UNEXPECTED
Wrong combination of INS byte and DO87/DO85 For DO87 the INS byte needs to be odd For DO85 the INS byte needs to be even

SM_DER_ENCODING_ERROR

public static final short SM_DER_ENCODING_ERROR

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SM_WRONG_LENGTH

public static final short SM_WRONG_LENGTH
Invalid length value of an array. This can be the case if
  • the DO87 has a to long lenth encoded or
  • the Lc in extended length APDU is longer than data fit into APDU buffer
  • a parsing error would lead to a ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

See Also:

MMF_PRECONDITION_FAILED

Call of implemented Multi MIFARE subfunction via MultiMIFARE.vCardAdmin(byte, byte[], short, short, byte[], short, short) failed because pre-initialization was missing

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MMF_FUNCTION_NOT_SUPPORTED

public static final short MMF_FUNCTION_NOT_SUPPORTED
Multi MIFARE subfunction not supported. This has the same meaning as MMF_NOT_SUPPORTED return code.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MMF_GENERAL_ERROR

public static final short MMF_GENERAL_ERROR
General Error in Multi MIFARE. Is returned after Multi MIFARE emulation function parameter consistency check has passed and internal processing error occurs.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MMF_NOT_SUPPORTED

public static final short MMF_NOT_SUPPORTED
Function is RFU or RESERVED. Multi MIFARE emulation function is not available. This function slot is empty at the emulation control interface. This has the same meaning as MMF_FUNCTION_NOT_SUPPORTED return code.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MMF_ATS_ERROR

public static final short MMF_ATS_ERROR
ATS error. Is a specialization of MMF_PARAM_ERROR

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MMF_PARAM_ERROR

public static final short MMF_PARAM_ERROR
Error in passed parameter(s). The Multi MIFARE emulation framework returns this error after checking the consistency of the given parameters during entry of the Multi MIFARE function. In case more detailed error codes are available that better describe the cause of the parameter error, a more detailed error is returned. More detailed parameter error codes are: ATS_ERROR.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

throwIt

public static void throwIt(short reason)
                    throws JCOPXException
Throws a JCOPXException with the given reason.

Parameters:
reason - the reason code, should map to one of the static fields of this class
Throws:
JCOPXException - with the given reason code
